# Resolve UI interaction and display bugs (2025-12-08 18:20-0500)

_**User (2025-12-08 02:56-0500)**_

Clicking certain elements doesnt always trigger the token chain updates in the right sidebar. For instance, clicking the nav menu items, badge, sub heading text, ghost button in hero. Clicking a heading that has gray text shows the wrong resolved value and a color green swatch. If an element on the page has a corresponding variable that has a chain should show when clicked on. Make "Click any element to inspect" more prominent. There are also random "right arrows" to the right of semantic and component chain blocks in sidebar that should be removed. See annotated screenshot.

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-opus-high-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is reporting several issues with the Theme Generator feature:

1. Clicking certain elements doesn't trigger token chain updates in the right sidebar (nav menu items, badge, sub heading text, ghost button in hero)
2. Clicking a heading with gray text shows wrong resolved value and green color swatch
3. Elements with corresponding variables that have a chain should show when clicked
4. "Click any element to inspect" should be more prominent
5. Random "right arrows" to the right of semantic and component chain blocks should be removed

I need to look at the theme generator code to understand how the element inspection and token chain display works. Let me start by reading the relevant files.</details></think>

panel.classList.remove('collapsed');\n        panel.style.maxHeight = panel.scrollHeight + 'px';\n        chevron.classList.remove('rotate-180');\n      } else {\n
